content.description:
A WI4ish cone leads to a good rest, a tree, and a semidetached column, at the top of which is a bolt anchor.

Directly to the right of Icy BC p3, access without climbing that route by walking around the lower tier and the 2nd pitch of Icy BC to the left.
Rack of ice screws, bolted anchor above the pillar, bailing from the tree is also an option.

Lower angle mixed route, lots of small edges and technical footwork, some mud sticks about two thirds of the way up. 
 Apparently it can ice up to be WI4.

Left and around the corner from Deeping Wall and before the Dihedral, it's the one with all the bolts.
14 bolts, screws if ice is fat enough to cover the bolts. Tree anchor at the top.

Broad, single pitch, sheet of ice that forms directly above where the trail hits the wall. Many variations are possible and multiple parties can easily climb at one time. 
 The name is a pun on the Icefields Parkway classic, Weeping Wall. The Tolkien reference appears to have been unintentional.

Center of the lower tier of the main Marble Canyon ice climbing area, top is visible from Hwy 99 when in.
Standard ice rack, tree anchors.

Technically a three pitch route but can be easily climbed as single pitches, the first two can each be bypassed by walking around to the left. 
 First pitch is WI3, second is WI4, third is WI4-5. Second and third pitches often form as cones around flowing water.

First pitch is on the far right of the Marble Canyon ice climbing area, the upper pitches are clearly visible from Hwy 99 when in.
Standard rack of ice screws, tree anchors.

Marble Canyon is one of the most popular ice climbing spots on the West coast of BC.

The ice forms consistently from approx. mid-Dec until March, with multiple routes that can be top ropped (rare for West Coast Ice), all accessible within a day trip from Vancouver.

On a Saturday in January, you can often expect multiple parties top roping along the main wall. Keep an eye on the West Coast Ice FB page for updates on whether large groups of BCMC or VOC members are going for practice sessions.
